timeline.message: black list rest tests from security tests

timeline.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: None of these are expecting errors in their yaml tests. Why are they part of the blacklist?
timeline.author: benwtrent
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -183,6 +183,9 @@ integTest.runner {
     'ml/job_groups/Test put job with id that matches an existing group',
     'ml/job_groups/Test put job with invalid group',
     'ml/ml_info/Test ml info',
+    'ml/pipeline_inference/Test pipeline regression simple',
+    'ml/pipeline_inference/Test pipeline agg referencing a single bucket',
+    'ml/pipeline_inference/Test all fields missing warning',

replies.bodyText:
MlWithSecurityIT and MlWithSecurityUserRoleIT both pass but MlWithSecurityInsufficientRoleIT fails because it expects ml tests to fail if the user does not have one of the ml roles (user, admin).
In this case you don't need the ml role to run search so the test fails. This definitely opens up a discussion point which needs to be resolved but that can happen outside of this PR. So I hacked a solution to get green
replies.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the explanation :D.
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
Actually looking at MlWithSecurityUserRoleIT I think we can do something similar and check which endpoint was invoked by the test.

  
    
      elasticsearch/x-pack/plugin/ml/qa/ml-with-security/src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/smoketest/MlWithSecurityUserRoleIT.java
    
    
         Line 46
      in
      5fa36da
    
    
    
    

        
          
           for (ExecutableSection section : testCandidate.getTestSection().getExecutableSections()) {
replies.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText:
The fix was quite simple I changed MlWithSecurityInsufficientRoleIT to check if an ml endpoint was called and only fail if that is the case.
I pushed that change in c47d42d
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText:
Loading the model could take seconds to finish. Depending on the threadpool/context this is bad.
This needs to be addressed before merge.
A potential solution to this would have pipeline aggs satisfy some sort of "rewrite" phase. This way the context has time to make an asynchronous call before executing.
timeline.author: benwtrent
benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: I agree with what Ben said about the need to remove the latch await, and if that is done there will hopefully be no need to catch InterruptedException here.  However, if we do still have to catch it, the handler should interrupt the current thread before throwing a different type of exception, because the class that owns the thread (e.g. a thread pool) may be relying on the interrupted status to decide what to do with the thread.
timeline.author: droberts195

timeline.bodyText: Most exceptions used in Elasticsearch are already RuntimeExceptions.  It would be better if these weren't wrapped in a generic runtime exception, as that will look less friendly in error messages and especially if it ends up getting transported to a different node.  So it would be better to only wrap the exception if it's not already instanceof RuntimeException.
timeline.author: droberts195

timeline.bodyText: It might be good to add a predictedValue() method to the InferenceResults interface. That way you can access it without these castings, especially since all inference results will either have a predicted value or null.
timeline.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
Yes the problem is value returns a Double and transformedPredictedValue returns an Object that may be a Double, String or Boolean.
I'll take another look though as it would be nice to simplify this
replies.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText: Object getPredictedValue() or something on the Interface could help. Fewer branches would be good :D
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: I went with Object getPredictedValue()
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText: awe snap! Since we are handling the paths...I wonder if we could handle paths like feature_importance.0.importance and feature_importance.0.feature_name
timeline.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
The original implementation I had converted the result to a map which the code would navigate through using the split path so it was more generic as you suggested. I actually changed that so I could take a few lines of code out of this PR.
The only use of this method I could find is in a Bucket Selector which will only work with Doubles so I though this was sufficient in the first case.
I'm open to the change though, maybe in the follow up PR?
replies.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText:
Follow up PR would be good.
Bucket select for when the most important feature is > X or when top class probability/score is > X would be neat!
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: similar to the feature_importance path. Could we support getting the top class probability?
timeline.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: Since it only accepts skip, you could just remove the option from the parser and hardcode it.
timeline.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText: GapPolicy is a common setting, it feels a little underhand to silently ignore the setting and rewrite it to skip.
replies.author: davidkyle

replies.bodyText: I think we'd just make it not something the parser recognized at all. Lots of aggs don't have a gap policy.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Yep, I meant removing it from the parser, so it'd throw an exception if the user tried to set it.  Most pipeline aggs have a gap_policy but it's not a required feature of pipelines by any means.
replies.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText:
👍  I assumed pipeline aggs must accept a gap_policy but that doesn't make sense in every case.
The code was silly anyway I was parsing the field validating it then never reading the setting again. It's gone now.
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText: I don't know what any of this is doing :), but I wanted to mention that by time this is called a lot of work will have been done on the data nodes.  So if any of this validation can be done earlier (parsing, etc) it would save some work.
timeline.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText: Very good point I've moved these checks to the validate() method
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText: Can these all be final?
timeline.author: polyfractal

timeline.bodyText: I think we can do bucket.getAggregations().asList().stream()... instead of StreamSupport.  The older pipelines have that laying around because they predated stream on the iterator itself iirc.
timeline.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText: 👍 Guilty of copy-and-paste here.
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText: Just an FYI if you care: there's currently no validation that the user doesn't enter the same bucket path multiple times with different keys.  It's not generally a problem elsewhere (and sometimes useful), but since your requirements might be different, wanted to mention it :)
timeline.author: polyfractal

timeline.bodyText:
Another Note: NaN or infinite could also mean the agg actually generate a NaN/Infinite.  Unfortunately there's not a good way of knowing without inspecting the underlying agg itself and seeing if it's using its placeholder value.
Other pipelines don't particularly care, all NaN/Infinite are bad, so it's never been a problem.  But YMMV :)
timeline.author: polyfractal
benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: Suggested change
timeline.author: benwtrent
benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Good suggestion I've implemented the builder
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText:
These types of validations seem like they belong in the agg parser.
Maybe we should always parse the named objects into a ResultsFieldUpdate object or something.
At a minimum, these validations should occur before we attempt to load the model.
timeline.author: benwtrent

timeline.bodyText: Suggested change
timeline.author: benwtrent
benwtrent
benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
I've changed this again 😞  now it only respects the value property.
I've deleted an awful lot of branching code because as we discussed above we can come up with a better solution in a later PR
replies.author: davidkyle

timeline.bodyText: I do not see where this is used or referenced.
timeline.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: These are usually in the HLRC.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: But in that case it should be in the HLRC itself.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText:
This class is used in InternalInferenceAggregationTests which extends InternalAggregationTestCase. It is the base test that requires an implementation of ParsedAggregation.
I think the reason the class is in the src directory rather than test is that as Nik said it is used by the HLRC or at least that is the convention I've followed.
replies.author: davidkyle

@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+[role="xpack"]
+[testenv="basic"]

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            ==== Configuration options for Inference Models
          
          
            
            ==== Configuration options for {infer} models
timeline.author: szabosteve
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+[role="xpack"]
+[testenv="basic"]
+[[search-aggregations-pipeline-inference-bucket-aggregation]]
+=== Inference Bucket Aggregation
+
+A parent pipeline aggregation which loads a pre-trained model and performs inference on the
+collated result field from the parent bucket aggregation.
+
+==== Syntax
+
+A `inference` aggregation looks like this in isolation:
+
+[source,js]
+--------------------------------------------------
+{
+    "inference": {
+        "model_id": "a_model_for_inference", <1>
+        "inference_config": { <2>
+            "regression_config": {
+                "num_top_feature_importance_values": 2
+            }
+        },
+        "buckets_path": {
+            "avg_cost": "avg_agg", <3>
+            "max_cost": "max_agg"
+        }
+    }
+}
+--------------------------------------------------
+// NOTCONSOLE
+<1> The ID of model to use.
+<2> The optional inference config which overrides the model's default settings
+<3> Map the value of `avg_agg` to the model's input field `avg_cost`
+
+[[inference-bucket-params]]
+.`inference` Parameters
+[options="header"]
+|===
+|Parameter Name |Description |Required |Default Value
+| `model_id`         | The ID of the model to load and infer against       | Required  | -
+| `inference_config` | Contains the inference type and its options. There are two types: <<inference-agg-regression-opt,`regression`>> and <<inference-agg-classification-opt,`classification`>>  | Optional | -
+| `buckets_path`     | Defines the paths to the input aggregations and maps the aggregation names to the field names expected by the model.
+See <<buckets-path-syntax>> for more details | Required       | -
+|===
+
+
+==== Configuration options for Inference Models

timeline.bodyText:

timeline.author: szabosteve
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+[role="xpack"]
+[testenv="basic"]
+[[search-aggregations-pipeline-inference-bucket-aggregation]]
+=== Inference Bucket Aggregation
+
+A parent pipeline aggregation which loads a pre-trained model and performs inference on the
+collated result field from the parent bucket aggregation.
+
+==== Syntax
+
+A `inference` aggregation looks like this in isolation:
+
+[source,js]
+--------------------------------------------------
+{
+    "inference": {
+        "model_id": "a_model_for_inference", <1>
+        "inference_config": { <2>
+            "regression_config": {
+                "num_top_feature_importance_values": 2
+            }
+        },
+        "buckets_path": {
+            "avg_cost": "avg_agg", <3>
+            "max_cost": "max_agg"
+        }
+    }
+}
+--------------------------------------------------
+// NOTCONSOLE
+<1> The ID of model to use.
+<2> The optional inference config which overrides the model's default settings
+<3> Map the value of `avg_agg` to the model's input field `avg_cost`
+
+[[inference-bucket-params]]
+.`inference` Parameters
+[options="header"]
+|===
+|Parameter Name |Description |Required |Default Value
+| `model_id`         | The ID of the model to load and infer against       | Required  | -
+| `inference_config` | Contains the inference type and its options. There are two types: <<inference-agg-regression-opt,`regression`>> and <<inference-agg-classification-opt,`classification`>>  | Optional | -
+| `buckets_path`     | Defines the paths to the input aggregations and maps the aggregation names to the field names expected by the model.
+See <<buckets-path-syntax>> for more details | Required       | -
+|===
+
+
+==== Configuration options for Inference Models
+The `inference_config` setting is optional and usaully isn't required as the pre-trained models come equipped with sensible defaults.
+In the context of aggregations some options can overridden for each of the 2 types of model.
+
+[discrete]
+[[inference-agg-regression-opt]]
+===== Configuration options for {regression-cap} Models

timeline.author: szabosteve
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,75 @@
+[role="xpack"]
+[testenv="basic"]
+[[search-aggregations-pipeline-inference-bucket-aggregation]]
+=== Inference Bucket Aggregation
+
+A parent pipeline aggregation which loads a pre-trained model and performs inference on the
+collated result field from the parent bucket aggregation.
+
+==== Syntax
+
+A `inference` aggregation looks like this in isolation:
+
+[source,js]
+--------------------------------------------------
+{
+    "inference": {
+        "model_id": "a_model_for_inference", <1>
+        "inference_config": { <2>
+            "regression_config": {
+                "num_top_feature_importance_values": 2
+            }
+        },
+        "buckets_path": {
+            "avg_cost": "avg_agg", <3>
+            "max_cost": "max_agg"
+        }
+    }
+}
+--------------------------------------------------
+// NOTCONSOLE
+<1> The ID of model to use.
+<2> The optional inference config which overrides the model's default settings
+<3> Map the value of `avg_agg` to the model's input field `avg_cost`
+
+[[inference-bucket-params]]
+.`inference` Parameters
+[options="header"]
+|===
+|Parameter Name |Description |Required |Default Value
+| `model_id`         | The ID of the model to load and infer against       | Required  | -
+| `inference_config` | Contains the inference type and its options. There are two types: <<inference-agg-regression-opt,`regression`>> and <<inference-agg-classification-opt,`classification`>>  | Optional | -
+| `buckets_path`     | Defines the paths to the input aggregations and maps the aggregation names to the field names expected by the model.
+See <<buckets-path-syntax>> for more details | Required       | -
+|===
+
+
+==== Configuration options for Inference Models
+The `inference_config` setting is optional and usaully isn't required as the pre-trained models come equipped with sensible defaults.
+In the context of aggregations some options can overridden for each of the 2 types of model.
+
+[discrete]
+[[inference-agg-regression-opt]]
+===== Configuration options for {regression-cap} Models
+
+`num_top_feature_importance_values`::
+(Optional, integer)
+include::{es-repo-dir}/ml/ml-shared.asciidoc[tag=inference-config-regression-num-top-feature-importance-values]
+
+[discrete]
+[[inference-agg-classification-opt]]
+===== Configuration options for {classification-cap} Models

timeline.bodyText: I'm ok to merge this, but I'll work immediately on replacing it with a rewrite. I don't think we can release this code.
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I opened #58878 which should make this a thing we don't need to do any more. I've not made sure the tests pass with that yet, but I think it'll work soon enough.
